definition: extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me

sentences.english: My grandparents feed their pigs with leftovers .
sentences.chinese: 我的祖父母用廚餘餵豬。

sentences.english: That means each person on average wastes about half-a-kilogram a day.
sentences.chinese: 換言之，每人每天平均製造半公斤廚餘。

sentences.english: This study include the feasibility of food waste thermophilic hydrogen fermentation.
sentences.chinese: 在本研究中也進行廚餘高溫發酵之可行性探討。

sentences.english: Yes, they help us recycle leftovers.
sentences.chinese: 是的，他們幫助我們處理廚餘垃圾。

sentences.english: Instead of filling up a garbage bag with this kitchen waste, many people choose to compost it.
sentences.chinese: 與其讓廚餘裝滿垃圾袋，許多人選擇把它們拿來堆肥。

sentences.english: In order to reduce spam please try to buy kitchen clean vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 爲了減少廚餘垃圾請儘量買淨菜。

sentences.english: I watched them collecting food scraps and recycling batteries.
sentences.chinese: 我看他們收集廚餘和回收電池。

definition: environmental sanitation/abbr. to 環衛|环卫[huan2 wei4]
to stock up/to lay in supplies/to hoard (for speculation)/to corner the market in sth
